intro: Ateixa andina, commonly known as Andean broom, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in high-altitude regions, often growing in rocky or arid soils. It has adapted to harsh environmental conditions through its deep root system and water-conserving features. Ateixa andina is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
